column5: Thank you for alerting everyone. I usually stay at Best Western Dryden for Ghost River trip. Decided to try Sioux Lookout Inn this year for a short drive on check-in day. FYI to anyone else that has a booking @ Sioux Lookout Inn: Best to call Dryden hotels to book. For our date (August 4-5) there was no availability online at Holiday Inn Express or Best Western. Called both and they both had availability for King and 2 Queen rooms.

Yes, this is the old Best Western. I just called them after reading this and learned that it has been sold and that they turn over the keys June 4th. We are staying there Friday June 2nd and thankfully they will be open. We have stayed there every year, minus COVID lockdown, for 15 years.

Please be advised- on June 4, 2023 , The Sioux Lookout Inn is closing in order to be converted into a “ hostel” Medical Center for the Sioux Lookout area. Those anglers that have reservations there should make arrangements NOW to re book at other hotels ! Just found out today when canceling one of the rooms I had booked. I think a lot of folks will wind up without a place to stay, or have to stay in Dryden unless you take action quickly. My PSA for you all. Best Regards, TVTYD
Thank you for this. I had heard rumors that it was closing.
Is that place the old Best Western?
What are some decent options to stay one night in Sioux Lookout?
Pack a pillow, pull off at a safe spot, recline the seats and crash is what we do.
The Lamplighter Inn or the Forest Inn I believe is another option. PjShorthorn
Stayed at the "old" Lamplighter last Sept.. My suggestion is to avoid at all costs.. The place has turned into a pig sty... Just a horrible experience to say the least !!
It was many years ago I stayed there,thanks for warning others!
I'm surprised to hear that. It has been a while since my last visit so it is very possible that ownership has changed. Good to know. PjShorthorn
